title: Stock Futures Edge Up After S&P 500 Hits Record
sub_head: Turkeyâ€™s lira falls ahead of expected rate cut; European natural-gas prices jump
body:
U.S. stock futures pointed to muted gains for major indexes ahead of a busy week of central-bank decisions in major economies.
Futures for the S&P 500 rose 0.2% Monday, after the benchmark gauge closed last week at its 67th record high of 2021. Contracts for the Dow Jones Industrial Average, which sits just shy of an all-time high, also ticked up 0.2%, as did futures for the technology-heavy Nasdaq-100.
